revised_title: Absorption Spectra of Alkyl Derivatives of Elements
tldr: The authors studied the absorption spectra of polyatomic molecules containing methyl and ethyl radicals to understand the electronic configurations and chemical bonds within these molecules. They examined a series of alkyl derivatives of elements, such as zinc dimethyl and cadmium diethyl, and found that the absorption spectra provided valuable information about the energies of chemical linkages and interatomic distances. The study also helped explain the mechanism and nature of primary processes in photochemical decomposition.
